questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Microsoft Power Platform solutions.

The company requests information on the features that are supported by Power Fx.

You need to identify the features of Power Fx.

What should you identify?

choices.B: It uses an undefined value for uninitialized variables.
choices.C: It uses formulas that are similar to Microsoft Excel formulas.
choices.A: It is available for purchase through a Microsoft reseller.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
c correct
C. It uses formulas that are similar to Microsoft Excel formulas: Power Fx is designed to be familiar to users of Excel, leveraging similar syntax and functions

Selected Answer: A
A is correct the others are wrong

choices.C: It uses an undefined value for uninitialized variables.
choices.A: It uses imperative and declarative logic.
choices.B: It is available for purchase through a Microsoft reseller.

questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Microsoft Power Platform solutions.

The company requests information on the features that are supported by Power Fx.

You need to identify the features of Power Fx.

What should you identify?

choices.A: Manually refresh the data source on the published Power BI report
choices.C: Publish the Power BI report from Power BI Desktop and reshare to any users
choices.D: Publish the Power BI report from Power BI Desktop

questions.question_text:
You create and publish a Power BI report that contains an embedded canvas app. The report will be used by multiple people.
The canvas app has an issue that must be corrected.
You update the canvas app.
You need to ensure that the updated canvas app is available in the published Power BI report.
What should you do?

comments.content: Updating Cavas App does not contain publishing it? I always publish after the update is done.

discussion.content: not correct, it should publish the canvas app

comments.content: agreed i just try. after publish canvas app if you open report it have all the new changes
Are you sure? Power BI data (taken from source) are refreshing automatically after specific period of time so if we want to do it asap, shouldn't we refresh this data manually?
I tried that as well but you have to do publish in order to get latest changes.

I´m little confused. According to link below (also in Reveal solution section) it seems that you create Power BI report with embedded canvas app and then you just press "Save"

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-powerapp

discussion.content: Publish the canvas App should be the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Canvas apps are independent components, they're essentially linked elements. Changes made to the canvas app need to be published. The PBI report will recognize and display the updated version of the embedded canvas app.
Publish the power app

devs together strong
B

comments.content: But the question is saying only canvas app has an issue. No issue in power BI report. So we need to fix canvas app and re-publish it. If question says report is having an issue, then D is correct. But for now B is most suitable answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I think the answer should be D
For a Power BI report which is published to Power BI Service, any changes in the Power BI report require manually republishing to be reflected in Power BI Service.
In this case, the embedded app is in the Power BI report, so its changes need to be republished to make it available to users in Power BI Service
B. Publish the canvas app

Selected Answer: B
Publish the canvas app

Selected Answer: B
answer b

Selected Answer: B
La opción B tiene sentido

Selected Answer: B
On exam July, 23, 2022

Selected Answer: B
Wish they didn't use the word "update," they are trying to be so tricky. If you don't publish the update in powerapps, it wont be available in the PowerBI embed. Publishing the Canvas app is a required pre-req to be able to use it in PowerBI. Wether they imply "Update also means Publish," I have no idea. 

Go with B

Selected Answer: B
B. Publish the canvas app

Selected Answer: B
publish the canvas app, after that it will automatically refreshed in Power BI

Selected Answer: B
publish the canvas app

WOndering when they say in the question "You update the canvas app" if they don't include the publishing of the app with this? If so then A would make sense. Microsoft and the way they phrase there questions...make you wonderif they want to mesure our knowledge...

Selected Answer: B
Publish the power app

Selected Answer: B
on exam 10-Dec-2021. Pass with 870 marks
in exam 11/23/21

Ans: B
After you have completed building or making changes to your app, save and publish the app in Power Apps to see your app in the Power BI report.

Can someone please help me understand what the answer is?
The documentation presents multiple options

If you change the data fields associated with the visual, you must edit the app from within the Power BI service by selecting the ellipsis (...) and then selecting Edit. Otherwise, the changes won't be propagated to Power Apps, and the app will behave in unexpected ways.
"You must create a new app from Power Apps visual in Power BI report for the PowerBIIntegration.Refresh() function to be available in the app."

It's B - Publish the App
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/powerapps-custom-visual

"After you have completed building or making changes to your app, save and publish the app in Power Apps to see your app in the Power BI report."

In exam on 21 July 2021
I selected 'Manually refresh'.

comments.content: why don't you tell us the answer ?

discussion.content: So? What's the corecy answer?

You need to ensure that the updated canvas app is available in the published Power BI report.

I go with Answer A
B, publish canvas app. Question does not state anything about the data of the dashboard being up-to-date.

The Answer explanation says " If you change the data fields associated with the visual" but the scenario says I updated the Canvas app. No where does it state what I did with the app. So Publishing the app should update it everywhere where its being used. right?
why its not B?

questions.answer_description:
Step 1: Create a personal dashboard in the model-driven app
Add a Power BI dashboard to your model-driven app.
Step 2: Add a Power BI tile to the dashboard and select the Power BI dashboard in the app.
Add one Power BI tiles to your personal dashboard.
Step 3: Share the dashboard with the appropriate user in the app
Share the personal dashboard that contains Power BI visualizations: you must configure sharing in both Dataverse and Power BI, and the user or group must have the same credentials and appropriate level of access in both services. To share your personal dashboard in your app go to, Dashboards. In the list of dashboards, select the personal dashboard you want, and then select SHARE DASHBOARD.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/user/add-powerbi-dashboards

discussion.content:
In my opinion it's:
1) Pin the Power BI report to a new dashboard in the Power BI service
2) Create a personal dashboard in the model-driven app (as Power BI dashboards are always personal dashboards (that can be shared))
3) Add a power BI tile to the dashboard and select the Power BI dashboard in the app.

comments.content:
Copilot answer: 
1.Create a personal dashboard in the model-driven app: This allows you to add and customize the dashboard where the Power BI tile will be displayed.
2. Add a Power BI tile to the dashboard and select the Power BI dashboard in the app: This step integrates the Power BI tile into the model-driven app's dashboard, making the visualizations accessible within the app.
3. Ensure the dashboard is available to the appropriate security roles: This step ensures that the right users have access to the dashboard within the model-driven app.
Sharing the dashboard with the appropriate user in the app is indeed important, but it is typically done after ensuring the dashboard is available to the appropriate security roles
sounds correct.
I agree with Charles, the answer in the question is correct

no. this is incorrect. step #3 add power bi tile is not correct. see correct steps: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/user/add-powerbi-dashboards#embed--power-bi-tiles-on-your-personal-dashboard

this is not correct steps:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/add-powerbi-visual
doesn't make any sense. Pin it to what when you create the new dashboard in step 2?

discussion.content:
I just tryed it you cannot add a tile from a report. So you need to pin it to a Dashboard in Power BI first. So the answers are : 
1. Pin
2. Create
3. Add

1. Pin the report to a new dashboard in the PBI Service - The wording is confusing as always, but basically we need to create a dashboard from the report first. Then we also need to add the dashboard and report to a solution but since this is not provided in the options so we can skip it.
2. Create a personal dashboard in the MDA - "In the app designer on the command bar select Add page, select Dashboard, and then in the dashboard picker select Power BI dashboards." Why the heck they called it "personal dashboard" is beyond anyone's mind but let's just blame MS's typical confusing wordings.
3. Share the dashboard with the MDA's users - In order for the app's users to see the embedded dashboard, it needs to be shared with them as well.

Complete ref can be found here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/add-powerbi-visual

the answers are correct. the first and the last options make no sense to me. Pinning is more on the user side. Relating Dashboards to user roles, i have never seen that.
remains the 3 in the middle. First create dashboard, add tiles to the dashboard (which is adding and NOT pinning!), finally share (if it is not a system dashboard).

answer is missing a step. 
1) Pin the Power BI report to a new dashboard in the Power BI service

MISSING STEP: Add the dashboard and report to a solution
IF YOU DON'T ADD, you won't see the Power BI dashboard.
2) Create a personal dashboard in the model-driven app (as Power BI dashboards are always personal dashboards (that can be shared))
3) Add a power BI tile to the dashboard and select the Power BI dashboard in the app

comments.content: As per the Microsoft document, answers given are correct

actually, answer is correct. Don't confuse pinning a Tile. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/user/add-powerbi-dashboards

with pinning a report here: 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/add-powerbi-visual

discussion.content:
The answer should be:
1- pin
2- Create
3- Add 
Because the question didn't say to be available to users (Shared).

1- Pin the Power BI report to a new dashboard in the Power BI service.
2- Add a Power BI tile to the dashboard and select the Power BI dashboard in the app.
3- Ensure the dashboard is available to the appropriate security roles.

comments.content:
Never mind, you can do it - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/add-powerbi-visual

Since the question doesn't say anything about sharing, it's:
pin
create
add

discussion.content: Didn't know you could pin a report to a dashboard. I thought it was only allowed to pin a visual from the report to a dashboard.
Took the exam in August 2022. This question was on it.

I think the given answer are correct. 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/service-dashboard-create
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/add-powerbi-visual#create-a-new-model-driven-app-and-add-the-power-bi-embedded-report

Personally, I would say :
1. Pin the Power BI report to a new dashboard in the Power BI service
2. Create a personal dashboard in the model-driven app (the personal dashboard will necessarily be a Power BI Dashboard where you have to chose the work space and dashboard name, so the action to add a power BI tile makes no sense)
3. Share the dashboard with appropriate users in the app (this is necessary because it's a personal dashboard, security roles have nothing to do in this area)

comments.content:
Finally, it is not mentioned that the dashboard has to be shared and it is mentioned that the model driven app should display a power BI tile, I therefore join those who have selected the following solution:
Pin the Report
Create personal dashboard (Dynamics type)
Add Power BI tile

discussion.content:
Pin the Report
Create personal dashboard
Add Power BI tile

1) Pin the power BI report to a new dashboard in the Power BI service
2) Create a new Power BI personal dashboard in the model-driven app
3) Add a Power BI tile to the dashboard and select the power BI dashboard in the app

This is a bit confusing but I believe the answers are correct. The link given seems to be what they are going for. The only issue is that they never mentioned sharing the report but it make sense that you would want to do that once you finished. NOTE: the question states that the Power BI report is ready to share so I would not include Pin the Power BI report to a new dashboard in the Power BI Service.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/user/add-powerbi-dashboards

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You create a report by using Power BI Desktop and publish the report to the Power BI service. You enable Power BI visualization embedding in a model-driven app.
You need to configure the model-driven app to display a Power BI tile.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.B: From the Power BI Desktop menu, insert a Power Apps visual and include the required fields in the Power Apps data
choices.A: From the Power Apps Insert menu, add a Power BI tile
choices.D: Connect to Common Data Service from Power BI Desktop
choices.C: Publish the report to the Power BI service

questions.answer_description:
Step 1 (B): Here's how we embed PowerApps into a Power BI report:
1. Download and login to the Power BI desktop application
2. Click on (ג€¦) and select ג€Import from the marketplace.ג€
Step 2: Open Power BI desktop and use ג€Get dataג€ to connect with the Common Data Service data source.
Step 3: Publish the report to Power BI service.
Reference:
https://purple.telstra.com/blog/powerbi-integration-with-powerapps

discussion.content:
This link gives better explanation - 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/powerapps-custom-visual

comments.content: good link explanation thank you

discussion.content: The answer is correct!

Selected Answer: BCD
Process of Elimination - A. Add a tile is for Dashboards in D365

Answer is correct
B. From the Power BI Desktop menu, insert a Power Apps visual and include the required fields in the Power Apps data.
C. Publish the report to the Power BI service.
D. Connect to Common Data Service (now known as Microsoft Dataverse) from Power BI Desktop

Selected Answer: BCD
The given answer is correct
Took the exam in August 2022. This question was on it.
correct

questions.question_text:
You use Power BI Desktop to configure Power BI reports.
You need to create a canvas app that displays user account information and include the app in a Power BI report.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
